messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
Yes, I need some help. There was someone on my back porch, a black man.
And what is your address?
3613 Baywood Lane.
3613 Baywood? Uh-huh, Greenville, North Carolina.
And is he still out there?
I think so.
Are you in an apartment or a house?
I'm in a house.
And he's on your back porch?
He was, yes, ma'am.
Did you see what he was wearing?
It looked like a black shirt. He's a black guy.
And he's still out there?
I can hear him banging. He's trying to take my grill.
Trying to take your grill?
Yes, ma'am. I need to get in here, put some clothes on. I'm terrified.
Do you know how he got up there? Did he walk or did he ride?
He jumped over the fence in the backyard.
So he jumped over your fence?
Evidently.
What part of the house are you in?
He's on the front porch now, ma'am.
Now he's on the front porch?
On the back porch.
He's on the back porch still?
Yes, please, you need to help.
What part of the house are you in?
I'm in my bedroom.
Is that in the back or the front of the house?
I'm in the back.
Do you have a one-floor house or is it two-story?
It's two stories.
And you're downstairs or upstairs?
I'm downstairs. Please.
Can you look to see where he's running to?
I can. I'm scared. I'm in the bathroom.
You're in the bathroom with the door closed?
Yeah.
I understand if you want to be quiet, but I'm still here.
Can you still hear him moving around in the house?
Yes.
Where is he now?
In the living room.
Is he breaking in?
He's in the back bedroom on the first floor. He's breaking in. I can hear him.
Make sure that door is locked.
We're dispatching units to your location. I'm staying on the line with you.
I'm scared.
Just stay with me, okay? If you see him, say something so I know what's going on.
Do you think you might know who it is?
No.
Do you live at this residence by yourself?
Yes.
Can you still hear him in there?
Yeah.
Is he breaking things?
Yeah.
Is he still on the first floor?
Yeah.
The living room is in the front of the house, right?
Yes.
We've got officers outside your house right now, so hold tight.
Are there any lights on that you know of?
No.
Be advised, the suspect is now in the living room on the first floor.
I can still hear him.
Do you hear the officers outside? They might be making some noise.
Can you still hear him moving around?
Yes.
Where is he now? Still in the living room?
He’s running upstairs.
The officers are coming inside now, okay? Just stay on the line with me.
Is he still upstairs?
Yes.
We have officers on the way. Do you have motion lights outside the house?
No.
Okay, we have entry from the officers. Just stay with me.
Okay.
Do you have an attic space?
No, just a crawl space.
He's coming downstairs now!
Okay, the officers are inside with a dog. Just stay on the line with me.
I can hear them.
What's your name, ma'am?
Dean.
We have your location and the officers are inside.
Is that your alarm I heard?
Yes.
Just stay there. The officers should have contact any moment now.
Can I call someone for me?
My dispatcher is contacting your parents and your best friend, who is also a police officer.
The officers will be coming to make contact with you in the bathroom. Just a moment.
Can I open the door?
Wait just a second. Let me confirm.
Okay, you can come out now and make contact with the officers.
Thank you. Can I hang up now?
Yes, the officers are with you now. You can hang up.
